chunks.text: Data Analysts turn raw data into reports and dashboards. They define metrics, clean datasets, and run SQL queries.
They communicate insights to stakeholders and commonly use SQL, Excel, Python, and BI tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Core competencies: SQL querying, spreadsheet analysis, basic statistics, data visualization, and business storytelling.
Behavioral competencies: curiosity, attention to detail, and clear communication with non-technical teams.
End-to-end analytics foundations, including spreadsheets, SQL, and dashboards.
Hands-on Excel analysis skills and reporting workflows.
Build a KPI dashboard from a retail sales dataset and present monthly insights.
Data Scientists build predictive models and run experiments to solve business problems.
They handle data wrangling, feature engineering, model training, and evaluation using Python, SQL, statistics, and ML libraries.
Core competencies: statistics, machine learning, Python, data wrangling, and experiment design.
Behavioral competencies: hypothesis-driven thinking, strong storytelling, and collaboration with product and engineering.

title: Machine Learning by Andrew Ng (Coursera audit)

chunks.text: ML foundations covering supervised and unsupervised algorithms.
Fast practical Python for data work.
Train a classification model and present model metrics with business impact.
ML Engineers productionize models and build reliable ML systems.
They design data pipelines, serve models, monitor drift, and collaborate with software teams using Python, ML frameworks, Docker, and cloud services.
Core competencies: machine learning, software engineering, model deployment, CI/CD, and monitoring.
Behavioral competencies: reliability mindset, system thinking, and cross-team collaboration.
Hands-on ML basics with practical exercises.
Production ML systems, deployment, and monitoring practices.
Deploy a trained model behind a REST API with monitoring dashboards.
Software Engineers design, build, and maintain applications and services.
They write clean code, test features, review pull requests, and collaborate across teams using Git and common languages like Python, JavaScript, or Java.
Core competencies: programming fundamentals, data structures, debugging, and system design basics.
Behavioral competencies: collaboration, ownership, and continuous learning.
Foundational programming and problem solving.
Create a CRUD API with authentication and unit tests.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; target_horizon_weeks=156; strategy_tags=long_horizon, constraint_driven, stability_first, location_bound; goals=I hope to achieve a relatively stable income within three years, ideally earning over RMB 10,000 per month right after graduation | I am interested in technology, but I do not want to work long-term overtime or live in top-tier cities | I would consider pursuing a master’s degree, but I do not want to spend three years studying purely theoretical content; hard_constraints=I am interested in technology, but I do not want to work long-term overtime or live in top-tier cities | Shenzhen would be acceptable, but I prefer not to go to Beijing or Shanghai | I would consider pursuing a master’s degree, but I do not want to spend three years studying purely theoretical content

I am currently a sophomore majoring in Software Engineering. My academic performance is above average. My family comes from a typical working-class background and does not have many resources. I hope to achieve a relatively stable income within three years, ideally earning over RMB 10,000 per month right after graduation. I am interested in technology, but I do not want to work long-term overtime or live in top-tier cities. Shenzhen would be acceptable, but I prefer not to go to Beijing or Shanghai. I would consider pursuing a master’s degree, but I do not want to spend three years studying purely theoretical content. I am worried about not finding a job after graduation or being replaced by AI.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; strategy_tags=constraint_driven, ai_oriented, prefer_project; goals=I can accept lower income in the short term, but I do not want it to remain low permanently; hard_constraints=I can accept lower income in the short term, but I do not want it to remain low permanently

I am a freshman and do not have a clear direction for my future yet. My family’s financial situation is relatively comfortable, so I am not in urgent need of income. I have some interest in starting a business, but I am also afraid of failure. I do not like being overly controlled and I do not fit well in extremely competitive environments. I enjoy working on projects independently, such as building websites or developing automation tools. Money is important to me, but so is personal freedom. I can accept lower income in the short term, but I do not want it to remain low permanently.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; strategy_tags=constraint_driven, location_bound; goals=My family hopes that I will take the civil service exam | I can accept overtime, but I do not want frequent business travel | Ideally, I would like to stay in Guangzhou in the future; hard_constraints=I can accept overtime, but I do not want frequent business travel

I am currently a junior. My family hopes that I will take the civil service exam. Personally, I am not very interested in working within the government system, although I acknowledge that stability is attractive. I am introverted and do not enjoy frequent social interactions. I tend to work carefully, but I am not particularly efficient. My biggest concern is that if I do not choose a stable path and fail, it would be embarrassing. I can accept overtime, but I do not want frequent business travel. Ideally, I would like to stay in Guangzhou in the future.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; target_horizon_weeks=156; intensity_preference=high; strategy_tags=long_horizon, high_intensity, ai_oriented; goals=I want to transition into the AI field but do not know where to start | I can accept a decrease in income within the first year if necessary, but I hope to see significant improvement in two or three years

I graduated one year ago and currently work as a front-end developer in a small company, earning around RMB 7,000 per month. I feel that my growth is slow and my tasks are repetitive. I want to transition into the AI field but do not know where to start. I can accept a decrease in income within the first year if necessary, but I hope to see significant improvement in two or three years. I am open to moving to first-tier cities and can tolerate high-pressure environments. I have no financial burden from my family. My biggest fear is choosing the wrong direction and wasting time.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; strategy_tags=constraint_driven, stability_first; goals=I hope to earn a stable and above-average income, though it does not have to be extremely high | I can accept overtime, but I do not want to move into a purely managerial role | In the future, I would like to have some professional influence and decision-making authority; hard_constraints=I can accept overtime, but I do not want to move into a purely managerial role

I transferred from a Mechanical Engineering background and am now studying Computer Science. My foundation is average, but I believe I have decent learning ability. I enjoy solving complex problems, especially logical ones. I do not care much about reputation, but I value technical depth. I hope to earn a stable and above-average income, though it does not have to be extremely high. I can accept overtime, but I do not want to move into a purely managerial role. In the future, I would like to have some professional influence and decision-making authority.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; strategy_tags=constraint_driven; goals=I just know that I do not want an overly exhausting lifestyle; hard_constraints=My family’s financial situation is average as well, and I need to earn income immediately after graduation | I just know that I do not want an overly exhausting lifestyle

My academic performance is average and I do not have any outstanding skills. My family’s financial situation is average as well, and I need to earn income immediately after graduation. I am not sure what I truly like;

ed to earn income immediately after graduation. I am not sure what I truly like; I just know that I do not want an overly exhausting lifestyle. I can accept a stable but modest income. I am open to relocating, but preferably not too far away. I am not considering graduate school. I am concerned that I may not be competitive enough compared to others.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; target_horizon_weeks=260; intensity_preference=high; strategy_tags=long_horizon, high_intensity, location_bound; goals=I hope to enter a core technical role within five years

I am disciplined and able to concentrate for long periods of time. I feel a sense of accomplishment when solving algorithm problems. I am willing to endure high-intensity work in exchange for high income and rapid growth. I am open to working in Beijing, Shanghai, or Shenzhen. I do not care much about working hours as long as I gain valuable experience and resources. I hope to enter a core technical role within five years. My family supports me and allows me to experiment for three years.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; intensity_preference=high; strategy_tags=high_intensity, constraint_driven, location_bound; goals=I can tolerate pressure, but I do not want to work under a long-term 996 schedule; hard_constraints=I can tolerate pressure, but I do not want to work under a long-term 996 schedule

I am outgoing and enjoy interacting with people. I feel energized when working in sales or negotiating partnerships. I am not well suited for long periods of isolated coding work. Income is important to me, but I prefer compensation that is directly linked to performance. I can tolerate pressure, but I do not want to work under a long-term 996 schedule. I am willing to move to a first-tier city.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; target_horizon_weeks=260; strategy_tags=long_horizon, constraint_driven, prefer_project; goals=I do not want to work as an employee for my entire life, but I also do not know what kind of business I would start; hard_constraints=I do not want to work as an employee for my entire life, but I also do not know what kind of business I would start

I do not want to work as an employee for my entire life, but I also do not know what kind of business I would start. I am interested in AI mainly because it seems to be a major trend. I do not have many resources or particularly strong abilities at the moment. I can accept low-cost experimentation, such as running small side projects. My biggest fear is choosing the wrong direction and losing three to five years without being able to recover.

Profile case summary for retrieval.; intensity_preference=low; strategy_tags=low_intensity, constraint_driven, stability_first; goals=My primary goal is stability | I want a fixed income, predictable working hours, and to live in a stable location | I hope to take care of my family in the future and would prefer not to work long-term overtime; hard_constraints=I hope to take care of my family in the future and would prefer not to work long-term overtime

My primary goal is stability. I want a fixed income, predictable working hours, and to live in a stable location. I do not pursue extremely high income and I dislike risk. I can accept slower growth as long as there are no frequent changes. I hope to take care of my family in the future and would prefer not to work long-term overtime.
